column4: Morning gentlefolks :) Can anyone tell me how to mount an external harddrive in gutsy? It's formatted in NFTS but I can't read it :(
it should pick it up automatically if you have hot-plugging enabled
Not sure if I have :) Just installed this day, where do I enable it?
Thanks :) it is enabled though :S Still doesn't work :S
The error message i get is: "$LogFile indicates unclean shutdown (0, 0) Failed to mount ' /dev/sdb1': Operation not supported Mount is denied because NTFS is marked to be in use."
assuming that's the place where your processes are located
I haven't changed anything :) But shouldn't I write something like cd in front or something
no just run that and see let me the message
shoot, i dont remember the location to ubuntus processes, using fedora now
